plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A tall perennial plant native to western North America, known for its dense spikes of vibrant flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.funFact: Lupines fix nitrogen in the soil, improving soil fertility and helping other plants grow.

plants.name: Rosa rubiginosa
plants.description: A species of wild rose with fragrant pink flowers and thorny stems, often found in hedgerows and meadows.
plants.funFact: The leaves of Sweet Briar release a distinctive apple-like scent when crushed.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: A night-blooming annual or perennial plant often grown in gardens for its fragrant, tubular white or cream flowers.
plants.funFact: Flowering Tobacco releases a sweet scent in the evening to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths.

plants.name: Grevillea rosmarinifolia
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to Australia with needle-like leaves and bright spider-like flowers that provide nectar for birds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late autumn to early spring in Australia, but cultivated varieties may bloom sporadically in other regions
plants.funFact: Grevilleas are part of the Proteaceae family and have specialized flowers adapted to bird pollination.
